verses.verse: Then <S%H347>Job<s%> <S%H6030>answered<s%> and <S%H559>said,<s%>
I <S%H3045>know<s%> it is <S%H3651>so<s%> of a <S%H551>truth:<s%> but <S%H4100>how<s%> should <S%H582>man<s%> be <S%H6663>just<s%> with <S%H410>God?<s%>
<S%H518>If<s%> he will <S%H7378>contend<s%> with him, he <S%H3808>cannot<s%> <S%H6030>answer<s%> him <S%H259>one<s%> of a <S%H505>thousand.<s%>

He is <S%H2450>wise<s%> in <S%H3824>heart,<s%> and <S%H533>mighty<s%> in <S%H3581>strength:<s%> <S%H4310>who<s%> has <S%H7185>hardened<s%> himself <S%H413>against<s%> him, and has <S%H7999>prospered?<s%>
Which <S%H6275>removes<s%> the <S%H2022>mountains,<s%> and they <S%H3045>know<s%> not: <S%H834>which<s%> <S%H2015>overturns<s%> them in his <S%H639>anger.<s%>
Which <S%H7264>shakes<s%> the <S%H776>earth<s%> out of her <S%H4725>place,<s%> and the <S%H5982>pillars<s%> thereof <S%H6426>tremble.<s%>
Which <S%H559>commands<s%> the <S%H2775>sun,<s%> and it <S%H2224>rises<s%> not; and <S%H2856>seals<s%> up the <S%H3556>stars.<s%>
Which <S%H905>alone<s%> <S%H5186>spreads<s%> out the <S%H8064>heavens,<s%> and <S%H1869>treads<s%> on the <S%H1116>waves<s%> of the <S%H3220>sea.<s%>
Which <S%H6213>makes<s%> <S%H5906>Arcturus,<s%> <S%H3685>Orion,<s%> and <S%H3598>Pleiades,<s%> and the <S%H2315>chambers<s%> of the <S%H8486>south.<s%>
Which <S%H6213>does<s%> <S%H1419>great<s%> things <S%H369>past<s%> <S%H2714>finding<s%> out; yes, and <S%H6381>wonders<s%> <S%H5704>without<s%> <S%H369><s%> <S%H4557>number.<s%>
<S%H2005>See,<s%> he <S%H5674>goes<s%> by me, and I <S%H7200>see<s%> him not: he <S%H2498>passes<s%> on also, but I <S%H995>perceive<s%> him not.
<S%H2005>Behold,<s%> he <S%H2862>takes<s%> <S%H2862>away,<s%> <S%H4310>who<s%> can <S%H7725>hinder<s%> him? <S%H4310>who<s%> will <S%H559>say<s%> to him, <S%H4100>What<s%> <S%H6213>do<s%> you?
If <S%H433>God<s%> will not <S%H7725>withdraw<s%> his <S%H639>anger,<s%> the <S%H7293>proud<s%> <S%H5826>helpers<s%> do <S%H7817>stoop<s%> <S%H8478>under<s%> him.
<S%H637>How<s%> <S%H637>much<s%> <S%H3588><s%> less shall I <S%H6030>answer<s%> him, and <S%H977>choose<s%> out my <S%H1697>words<s%> to reason with him?
<S%H834>Whom,<s%> <S%H518>though<s%> I were <S%H6663>righteous,<s%> yet would I not <S%H6030>answer,<s%> but I would make <S%H2603>supplication<s%> to my <S%H8199>judge.<s%>
<S%H518>If<s%> I had <S%H7121>called,<s%> and he had <S%H6030>answered<s%> me; yet would I not <S%H539>believe<s%> that he had <S%H238>listened<s%> to my <S%H6963>voice.<s%>
For he <S%H7779>breaks<s%> me with a <S%H8183>tempest,<s%> and <S%H7235>multiplies<s%> my <S%H6482>wounds<s%> <S%H2600>without<s%> <S%H2600>cause.<s%>
He will not <S%H5414>suffer<s%> me to take my <S%H7307>breath,<s%> but <S%H7646>fills<s%> me with <S%H4472>bitterness.<s%>
<S%H518>If<s%> I speak of <S%H3581>strength,<s%> <S%H2009>see,<s%> he is <S%H533>strong:<s%> and <S%H518>if<s%> of <S%H4941>judgment,<s%> <S%H4310>who<s%> shall <S%H3259>set<s%> me a time to plead?
<S%H518>If<s%> I <S%H6663>justify<s%> myself, my own <S%H6310>mouth<s%> shall <S%H7561>condemn<s%> me: if I say, I am <S%H8535>perfect,<s%> it shall also prove me <S%H6140>perverse.<s%>
Though I were <S%H8535>perfect,<s%> yet would I not <S%H3045>know<s%> my <S%H5315>soul:<s%> I would <S%H3988>despise<s%> my <S%H2416>life.<s%>
<S%H1931>This<s%> is <S%H259>one<s%> thing, <S%H5921>therefore<s%> <S%H3651><s%> I <S%H559>said<s%> it, He <S%H3615>destroys<s%> the <S%H8535>perfect<s%> and the <S%H7563>wicked.<s%>
<S%H518>If<s%> the <S%H7752>whip<s%> <S%H4191>slay<s%> <S%H6597>suddenly,<s%> he will <S%H3932>laugh<s%> at the <S%H4531>trial<s%> of the <S%H5355>innocent.<s%>

The <S%H776>earth<s%> is <S%H5414>given<s%> into the <S%H3027>hand<s%> of the <S%H7563>wicked:<s%> he <S%H4374>covers<s%> the <S%H6440>faces<s%> of the <S%H8199>judges<s%> thereof; <S%H518>if<s%> not, <S%H645>where,<s%> and <S%H4310>who<s%> is he?
Now my <S%H3117>days<s%> are <S%H7043>swifter<s%> <S%H4480>than<s%> a <S%H7323>post:<s%> they <S%H1272>flee<s%> away, they <S%H7200>see<s%> <S%H3808>no<s%> <S%H2896>good.<s%>
They are <S%H2498>passed<s%> away as the <S%H16>swift<s%> <S%H591>ships:<s%> as the <S%H5404>eagle<s%> that <S%H2907>hastens<s%> to the <S%H400>prey.<s%>
<S%H518>If<s%> I <S%H559>say,<s%> I will <S%H7911>forget<s%> my <S%H7879>complaint,<s%> I will <S%H5800>leave<s%> off my <S%H6440>heaviness,<s%> and <S%H1082>comfort<s%> myself:
I am <S%H3025>afraid<s%> of <S%H3605>all<s%> my <S%H6094>sorrows,<s%> I <S%H3045>know<s%> that you will not hold me <S%H5352>innocent.<s%>
If I be <S%H7561>wicked,<s%> <S%H4100>why<s%> then <S%H3021>labor<s%> I in <S%H1892>vain?<s%>
<S%H518>If<s%> I <S%H7364>wash<s%> myself with <S%H7950>snow<s%> <S%H7950>water,<s%> and make my <S%H3709>hands<s%> <S%H1253>never<s%> so <S%H2141>clean;<s%>
<S%H227>Yet<s%> shall you <S%H2881>plunge<s%> me in the <S%H7845>ditch,<s%> and my own <S%H8008>clothes<s%> shall <S%H8581>abhor<s%> me.
For he is not a <S%H376>man,<s%> as I am, that I should <S%H6030>answer<s%> him, and we should <S%H935>come<s%> <S%H3162>together<s%> in <S%H4941>judgment.<s%>
<S%H3808>Neither<s%> is there any <S%H3198>judge<s%> <S%H996>between<s%> us, that might <S%H7896>lay<s%> his <S%H3027>hand<s%> on us <S%H8147>both.<s%>
Let him <S%H5493>take<s%> his <S%H7626>rod<s%> <S%H5493>away<s%> from me, and let not his <S%H367>fear<s%> <S%H1204>terrify<s%> me:
Then would I <S%H1696>speak,<s%> and not <S%H3372>fear<s%> him; but it is not <S%H3651>so<s%> with me.
